results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features panoramic views of the Red Rock Lakes near Colac, Victoria. The film features shots of a man and child on a hill, with the man holding a film camera, and shots of Duigan’s brother, Reginald Duigan, and children outside a large house.

results.title: Fred's Films. [Luna Park] [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Filmed in the mid 1960s by steam train enthusiast and home movie maker Fred Daley who captures a family outing to the popular sea-side amusement park in St Kilda. ‘Luna Park’ is shown in all its summertime glory with the ‘River Boats’, the ‘Dodgems’, the ‘Rotor’ (a washing spin cycle for humans!), ‘The Spinner’ and of course its famous wooden roller coasters, the ‘Big Dipper’ and the ‘Scenic Railway’. Courageous Fred even films during the ride where you catch a glimpse of Port Phillip Bay from the very top!

results.title: Fred's Films. Warburton Line 1963
results.brief_description: The ‘Warburton Line’ steam locomotive railway filmed originally in 1963, shows the clean and flowing Yarra River and the lush surrounds of the Yarra Valley as it meanders on its journey. Shot by Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm home movie maker, this is a tribute to the Line as two years later “despite opposition, 1965 line closed”. “But the rails are not silent in April 1968” when Fred and friends use a hand-pump rail car to run along the overgrown and forgotten tracks. His inter-title stating: “Now it’s goodbye Warburton June 1968 - perhaps the prettiest broad gauge line of all.” The line found new use years later having been converted to a walking and cycle track but one gets the feeling Fred was right about the use of it as a railway line as this film stands testament to the grandeur and beauty of the original steam adventure.

results.title: Fred's Films. Stepping South: Apollo Bay Jan 1963
results.brief_description:
It’s summer 1963, time to pack up the car and head to the beach. Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm home movie maker, follows his family’s trip to the beaches of Apollo Bay, the lush rain forest of Paradise and the powerful beauty of the Twelve Apostles.
Along the way we also see Lorne, Port Campbell and Cinema Point in the Otway Ranges.

results.title: Fred's Films. Our Family [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm home movie maker, follows his family’s trip into the City of Melbourne. Starting out at St. Kilda Road, they go on into town to sample coffee and sandwiches al fresco-style before journeying on to an exciting game of Australian Rules football at the MCG (Geelong vs. Hawthorn Grand Final 1963). The family meanders around the fountain at the Southern Cross hotel and ventures to Cook’s Cottage in the picturesque Fitzroy Gardens. They finish up the relaxing day with a cold beverage in the beer garden of the Chevron Hotel.

results.title: Fred's Films. Models for kids [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Model railways and miniature steam locomotives have been a great hobby for people passionate about engines and also about ‘quality’ family time. Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm movie maker, has captured a meeting of these enthusiasts running their miniature steam engines and pulling the kids along behind them in purpose built ‘carriages’. There is a sense of camaraderie and enthusiasm from the people tending to their fully functioning but small steam locomotives. Both the little kids and the grown up kids seem to be having a lovely day out.
[This film is the final segment from the original film ‘ARC Cement Works, Geelong’.]

results.title: Fred's Films. ARC Cement Works Geelong [excerpt]
results.brief_description: The A.R.C Cement Works, Geelong, in the early 1960s is faithfully captured here by Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm home movie maker. Fred has recorded a moment in industry that - post 2000 - no longer exists, that of the use of powerful steam locomotives. With the ‘loco’ pulling people on this occasion and not cement, this is most likely a farewell celebration to the use of the engines at the Plant. Fred’s titles tell us it is “3ft 6 Gauge” and there is a close up on an engine name-plate indicating this engine had come all the way from Manchester and another “1903 Leeds, Hudswell Clarke & Co Ltd No. 646”, a smaller black engine that had obviously been a working machine at the Cement Works for many a year. There is a sense of this being quite an occasion with many people visiting to take pictures and enjoy the plumes of steam from these majestic work horses.

results.title: Fred's Films. 'Tis Christmas
results.brief_description: Captured here by Fred Daley, steam train enthusiast and 8mm home movie maker are highlights of a Melbourne family during the mid 1960s. Christmas for Fred included showing the trains of Flinders St and a W-Class Tram in the City of Melbourne, along with the famous ‘Foy’s Corner’, corner of Bourke and Swanston St. There are some amusements in the gardens and some ‘Viking’ boats rowing on the Yarra. A Santa in the back of a truck can only mean the office Christmas party. The family relax at a swimming pool and have a picnic in a bush setting. Back to a brief sequence of a helicopter landing on the helipad on the Yarra River, then there is a road trip. This features some impressive footage from the camera mounted on the car, to the Mornington Peninsula and Rosebud. Fred and the family relax staying at a caravan park at the beach, go water skiing, spend time in paddle boats and sand dune frolicking. A highlight is the joy flight taken over the area. Returning to the city, the family enjoy a sunny day at ‘Luna Park’ with the wonderful rides and amusements on offer. Fred’s camera work on the ‘Scenic Railway’ in particular, shows his steady hand.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 11]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows Sydney street, harbour and beach scenes and a family holiday to Tasmania and New Zealand. There are scenes of Bondi Beach, Taronga Zoo and wild animals in captivity showing a monkey riding a bicycle and performing tricks with a trainer. There are scenes on board and farewelling a passenger liner and passenger steam ferries in Sydney Harbour.

There are street scenes around Hobart, including Wrest Point Hotel, and a road trip to Mount Wellington, showing views along the way. The film shows New Zealand port towns and ports as well as a tourist boat trip on the fjords and scenery at Milford Sound. The family visits Rotorua and a recreation of a Maori Village depicting traditional Maori dance and dress performed for tourists. There are also scenes on a cruise ship of recreational activities.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:00:00:00 Bondi Beach scene panorama showing beach and bathers
00:00:21:00 Sydney/Bondi street scenes showing cars, pedestrians and double decker bus
00:00:34:00 Taronga Zoo showing caged monkeys, birds, camels, zebra, impala, giraffes
00:01:15:00 horses, dogs and monkeys in costumes riding bicycles, doing tricks with trainer
00:01:56:00 farewelling a passenger liner with streamers at Sydney Harbour
00:02:21:00 crowded Sydney steam ferry at Sydney Harbour
00:02:51:00 Wrest Point Hotel, “Portlight Bar” sign with street and water scenes showing cars and pedestrians
00:03:11:00 Tasmanian Road sign indicating direction and distance to Tasman Highway, Lindisfarne, Cambridge Aerodrome, Bellerive
00:03:31:00 family group facing camera at lookout point on Mount Wellington (good fashion reference)
00:03:50:00 people on Mount Wellington look-out point taking photos with camera mounted on wooden tripod
00:03:59:00 Milford Sound tourist boat trip footage showing fjord and surrounding mountains, waterfalls, light planes flying, tourists on boat
00:05:25:00 New Zealand Port Town – possibly Wellington, showing rooftops and harbour
00:05:32:00 Wellington Cable Car, New Zealand
00:05:34:00 signage for Wellington Council Cable Car and entrance to Botanical Gardens
00:05:42:00 car driving along winding road above Wellington Harbour, driver waves out of the window
00:06:00:00 New Zealand street scenes showing buildings, pedestrians and cars
00:06:12:00 Orsova passenger ship in New Zealand port
00:06:29:00 ships, ferry and rower in a New Zealand port
00:06:43:00 Frankton Train Station sign
00:07:04:00 sign on side of building for Princes Gate Hotel. Tourist House License.
00:07:05:00 Waiariki Wai-Ora baths, showing bathers, signage and bathers around the pool
00:07:12:00 Maori women performing traditional dance for tourists in a recreation of a village
00:07:33:00 tourist women and children pose with Maori women dressed in traditional dress
00:07:38:00 male tourist and children pose with Maori women dressed in traditional dress
00:07:42:00 tourist women interact with Maori man dressed in traditional dress
00:07:45:00 Rotorua hot mud pools and geysers with tourists
00:07:57:00 children in wooden hot tubs at Rotorua
00:07:59:00 saucepans and kettles in hot tubs steaming over hot springs
00:08:01:00 tourist women and children posing with Maori woman and child as tourist attraction
00:08:05:00 close-up of Maori woman and child in traditional dress in tourist village
00:08:07:00 tourists wave from Kia Mau Mahara Bridge
00:08:14:00 tourists standing in front of N.Z. R. Road Services bus
00:08:33:00 people playing quoits on board a passenger ship with people in deckchairs and ocean in the background
00:08:38:00 people swimming in a pool on board a passenger liner with deckchairs in the background
00:08:46:00 woman on board ship sitting in deck chair posing with Orsova London Life Saving ring around her neck
00:08:49:00 older woman on board passenger liner sitting in deck chair posing with Orsova London Life Saving ring around her neck
00:08:50 young boy on board passenger liner sitting in deck chair posing with Orsova London Life Saving ring around her neck
00:08:52:00 man on board passenger liner sitting in deck chair posing with Orsova London Life Saving ring around her neck

description_for_label:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows Sydney street, harbour and beach scenes and a family holiday to Tasmania and New Zealand. There are scenes of Bondi Beach, Taronga Zoo and wild animals in captivity showing a monkey riding a bicycle and performing tricks with a trainer. There are scenes on board and farewelling a passenger liner and passenger steam ferries in Sydney Harbour.

There are street scenes around Hobart, including Wrest Point Hotel, and a road trip to Mount Wellington, showing views along the way. The film shows New Zealand port towns and ports as well as a tourist boat trip on the fjords and scenery at Milford Sound. The family visits Rotorua and a recreation of a Maori Village depicting traditional Maori dance and dress performed for tourists. There are also scenes on a cruise ship of recreational activities.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:00:00:00 Bondi Beach scene panorama showing beach and bathers
00:00:21:00 Sydney/Bondi street scenes showing cars, pedestrians and double decker bus
00:00:34:00 Taronga Zoo showing caged monkeys, birds, camels, zebra, impala, giraffes
00:01:15:00 horses, dogs and monkeys in costumes riding bicycles, doing tricks with trainer
00:01:56:00 farewelling a passenger liner with streamers at Sydney Harbour
00:02:21:00 crowded Sydney steam ferry at Sydney Harbour
00:02:51:00 Wrest Point Hotel, “Portlight Bar” sign with street and water scenes showing cars and pedestrians
00:03:11:00 Tasmanian Road sign indicating direction and distance to Tasman Highway, Lindisfarne, Cambridge Aerodrome, Bellerive
00:03:31:00 family group facing camera at lookout point on Mount Wellington (good fashion reference)
00:03:50:00 people on Mount Wellington look-out point taking photos with camera mounted on wooden tripod
00:03:59:00 Milford Sound tourist boat trip footage showing fjord and surrounding mountains, waterfalls, light planes flying, tourists on boat
00:05:25:00 New Zealand Port Town – possibly Wellington, showing rooftops and harbour
00:05:32:00 Wellington Cable Car, New Zealand
00:05:34:00 signage for Wellington Council Cable Car and entrance to Botanical Gardens
00:05:42:00 car driving along winding road above Wellington Harbour, driver waves out of the window
00:06:00:00 New Zealand street scenes showing buildings, pedestrians and cars
00:06:12:00 Orsova passenger ship in New Zealand port
00:06:29:00 ships, ferry and rower in a New Zealand port
00:06:43:00 Frankton Train Station sign
00:07:04:00 sign on side of building for Princes Gate Hotel. Tourist House License.
00:07:05:00 Waiariki Wai-Ora baths, showing bathers, signage and bathers around the pool
00:07:12:00 Maori women performing traditional dance for tourists in a recreation of a village
00:07:33:00 tourist women and children pose with Maori women dressed in traditional dress
00:07:38:00 male tourist and children pose with Maori women dressed in traditional dress
00:07:42:00 tourist women interact with Maori man dressed in traditional dress
00:07:45:00 Rotorua hot mud pools and geysers with tourists
00:07:57:00 children in wooden hot tubs at Rotorua
00:07:59:00 saucepans and kettles in hot tubs steaming over hot springs
00:08:01:00 tourist women and children posing with Maori woman and child as tourist attraction

00:08:07:00 tourists wave from Kia Mau Mahara Bridge

group.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection]
group.material_description:
5 x 400ft 9.5mm B&W silent home movies
7 x 8mm reels (4 x 100ft, 2 x 400ft)

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 12]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows snippets of family life while at play, at birthday celebrations and on holiday. We see the family drive across the bridge to Phillip Island and enjoy swimming and canoeing at the beach there. The reel also includes scenes of caravan camping, koalas and a trip to the war memorial at Mount Macedon. The family enjoy games of tennis, ball games and swings and roundabouts at a playground. The film includes good examples of fashion, Austin cars and recreational activities of the time.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:01:37:00 children with their dad in the water at the beach (good example of bathing fashion)
00:02:58:00 tennis match between mum and dad
00:04:29:00 car with caravan and family in bush camp setting
00:05:14:00 Austin car with family standing at the front talking and combing hair
00:05:58:00 children being pushed on swings in a park by their mother (good fashion and sunglasses references)
00:7:30:00 close-up of little girl’s face as she blows out her birthday candles and looks to camera
00:07:41:00 family in front of war memorial at Mount Macedon
00:08:36:00 steam train travelling on a country rail line
00:08:46:00 family looking out from a ferry window
00:08:52:00 kids on a roundabout at a playground
00:09:00:00 grandmother, mother and children sitting on a playground wall – the grandmother is shooting a water pistol.
00:09:08:00 children on playground roundabout and dad jumps on to join them
00:09:32:00 a koala sitting in a tree climbs to the top and looks down
00:09:45:00 family and friends stand in front of a picket fence (good example of family groups and fashion from the time)
00:10:01:00 wide shot as cars travel across the bridge to Phillip Island

00:10:14:00 POV from inside car as it drives over the Phillip Island bridge
